channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report E-2024080212
item.description:
Report E-2024080212

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7005
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Specialty Products Group, LLC driver discovered a slow leak coming from a hose on the trailer. Approximately 1 gallon of hydrobromic acid was released. Clean Harbors responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2024080595
item.description:
Report X-2024080595

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package came out the trailer damaged on one side of the box. It was sitting on the rollers in unload when QA inspected it. After seeing one side of the box wet, QA immediately got a red tote and brought the package to the hazmat cage to be processed properly. The package contains 4 bottles of Coil Cleaner. No inner packing to stop the bottles from leaking. Possibly being on the trailer and might have tipped over. At least one of the bottles had a loose cap. Very poorly shipped out by shipper by not putting enough inner packing inside the package.

item.title: Report E-2024080098
item.description:
Report E-2024080098

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-LSL contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1-gallon of Unsaturated Polyester Resin from one 55-gallon metal drum impacting the trailer floor. The drum was punctured by a forklift during loading. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE.
